examples.master: 교통 체증이 심한 시간대를 피하는 게 좋아요.

en.explanation: Means or system for moving people or goods.

examples.advanced: Using public transportation is good for the environment.
examples.master: It's better to avoid peak traffic hours.
카페리를 이용하면 차도 함께 실을 수 있어요.

en.explanation: A vehicle that travels on water.

examples.intermediate: You can go to Jeju Island by ship.
examples.advanced: I took a plane because I get seasick.
examples.master: You can bring your car if you use a car ferry.

ko.explanation: 엔진으로 움직이는 네 바퀴 달린 차.

examples.master: 자동차 유지비가 생각보다 많이 들어요.

en.explanation: A four-wheeled vehicle powered by an engine.

examples.advanced: Electric cars are becoming more common.
examples.master: Car maintenance costs more than you'd think.

ko.explanation: 페달을 밟아 바퀴를 굴리는 두 바퀴 탈것.

examples.master: 공유 자전거 서비스가 전국적으로 확대되고 있어요.

en.explanation: A two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling.

examples.advanced: Commuting by bicycle is good for your health.
examples.master: Bike-sharing services are expanding nationwide.
오토바이 면허를 따려면 별도 시험을 봐야 해요.

en.explanation: A two-wheeled vehicle with an engine.

examples.intermediate: You must wear a motorcycle helmet.
examples.master: You need to take a separate test to get a motorcycle license.
실시간 버스 도착 정보를 정류장에서 확인할 수 있어요.

en.explanation: A place where buses stop.

examples.advanced: I'll get off at the next stop.
examples.master: You can check real-time bus arrival info at the bus stop.

examples.advanced: 항구에서 배를 타고 일본에 갈 수 있어요.
examples.master: 인천항은 한국에서 가장 큰 국제 항구 중 하나예요.

en.explanation: A place where ships come and go.

examples.advanced: You can take a ship to Japan from the port.
examples.master: Incheon Port is one of the largest international ports in Korea.

examples.intermediate: 버스 요금은 현금으로 낼 수 있어요.
examples.master: 거리에 따라 추가 요금이 붙을 수 있어요.

en.explanation: Money paid to use transportation.

examples.intermediate: You can pay the bus fare in cash.
examples.advanced: You get a discount if you pay with a transit card.
examples.master: Additional charges may apply depending on the distance.

ko.explanation: 버스나 지하철 요금을 낼 때 쓰는 카드.

examples.master: 후불 교통카드는 한 달 치 요금을 나중에 결제해요.

en.explanation: A card used to pay bus or subway fares.

examples.beginner: Do you have a transit card?
examples.intermediate: I need to recharge my transit card.
examples.advanced: Transferring with a transit card saves money.
examples.master: A postpaid transit card charges the monthly fare later.
자동 충전 설정을 해 두면 편해요.

en.explanation: Adding money to a transit card.

examples.advanced: You can recharge at convenience stores too.
examples.master: It's convenient to set up automatic recharging.

ko.explanation: 한 교통수단에서 다른 교통수단으로 갈아타는 것.

examples.master: 버스-지하철 환승은 최대 5회까지 가능해요.

en.explanation: Changing from one mode of transport to another.

examples.advanced: You get a discount if you transfer within 30 minutes.
examples.master: Bus-subway transfers are possible up to 5 times.
출발이 지연되면 안내 방송을 잘 들으세요.

en.explanation: Starting to leave.

examples.advanced: Go to the boarding gate 10 minutes before departure.
examples.master: Listen carefully to announcements if there's a delay.
도착 후 수하물 찾는 곳으로 가세요.

en.explanation: Reaching the destination.

examples.intermediate: Please tell me the arrival time.
examples.advanced: We arrived 30 minutes earlier than scheduled.
examples.master: Go to baggage claim after arrival.
이 노선은 주말에만 운행해요.

en.explanation: The path a bus or subway follows.

examples.intermediate: How far does this route go?
examples.advanced: Look at the Line 2 route map.
examples.master: This route only operates on weekends.

examples.advanced: 노선도를 보면 환승역을 알 수 있어요.
examples.master: 앱에서 실시간 노선도를 확인할 수 있어요.

en.explanation: A map showing bus or subway routes.

examples.intermediate: Please give me a subway map.
examples.advanced: You can find transfer stations on the route map.
examples.master: You can check real-time route maps on the app.
탑승구가 멀면 셔틀 버스를 이용해요.

en.explanation: The place where you board an airplane.

examples.advanced: Please wait in front of the gate.
examples.master: Use a shuttle bus if the gate is far away.
수하물이 안 나오면 분실 신고를 해야 해요.

en.explanation: Bags carried when traveling.

examples.master: You need to file a lost report if your luggage doesn't come out.

ko.explanation: 비행기 안에 가지고 타는 작은 짐.

examples.advanced: 기내 짐은 좌석 위 선반에 넣으세요.
examples.master: 기내 짐 크기가 규정을 초과하면 탑승할 수 없어요.

en.explanation: Small bags taken into the airplane cabin.

examples.advanced: Put your carry-on in the overhead bin.
examples.master: You can't board if your carry-on exceeds size limits.
눈이 많이 오면 운행이 중단될 수 있어요.

en.explanation: Transportation running on scheduled routes.

examples.intermediate: What time is the last train?
examples.advanced: Service intervals are longer on weekends.
examples.master: Service may be suspended during heavy snow.
금요일 밤에는 막차 시간이 연장돼요.

en.explanation: The last bus or subway of the day.

examples.intermediate: What time is the last train?
examples.advanced: If you miss the last train, you need to take a taxi.
examples.master: Last train times are extended on Friday nights.
첫차 시간은 역마다 조금씩 달라요.

en.explanation: The first bus or subway of the day.

examples.intermediate: What time is the first train?
examples.advanced: You need to catch the first train to leave early morning.
examples.master: First train times vary slightly by station.

ko.explanation: 자동차 등을 조종하여 움직이게 하는 것.

examples.master: 졸음운전은 매우 위험해요.

en.explanation: Operating and controlling a vehicle.

examples.master: Drowsy driving is very dangerous.

ko.explanation: 자동차를 운전할 수 있는 자격을 증명하는 증서.

examples.master: 국제 면허증이 있으면 외국에서도 운전할 수 있어요.

en.explanation: A document certifying permission to drive.

examples.advanced: You should always carry your license.
examples.master: You can drive abroad with an international license.
발렛 주차 서비스를 이용하면 편해요.

en.explanation: A place to park cars.

examples.intermediate: I parked in the underground parking lot.
examples.advanced: The parking lot is full with no empty spaces.
examples.master: Using valet parking service is convenient.

ko.explanation: 차를 한 곳에 세워 두는 것.

examples.master: 평행 주차가 초보 운전자에게 제일 어려워요.

en.explanation: Stopping and leaving a car in a place.

examples.advanced: You have to pay a fine for illegal parking.
examples.master: Parallel parking is hardest for beginner drivers.

ko.explanation: 교통을 조절하는 빨강, 노랑, 초록 불.

examples.master: 보행자 신호등이 깜빡일 때는 건너지 마세요.

en.explanation: Red, yellow, and green lights controlling traffic.

examples.advanced: Watch the traffic light carefully before crossing.
examples.master: Don't cross when the pedestrian light is flashing.

ko.explanation: 사람들이 길을 건널 수 있게 표시한 곳.

examples.master: 횡단보도가 없는 곳에서 건너면 위험해요.

en.explanation: A marked place for people to cross the street.

examples.advanced: You must always stop at crosswalks.
examples.master: It's dangerous to cross where there's no crosswalk.
인도에 불법 주차된 차 때문에 보행자가 차도로 다녀요.

en.explanation: A path for people to walk on.

examples.intermediate: Bicycles shouldn't ride on the sidewalk.
examples.advanced: The sidewalk is narrow, making it hard to walk.
examples.master: Pedestrians use the road because of illegally parked cars on the sidewalk.
버스 전용 차도를 일반 차가 이용하면 벌금이에요.

en.explanation: A path for cars to drive on.

examples.advanced: The road and sidewalk are separated.
examples.master: Regular cars get fined for using the bus-only lane.

ko.explanation: 차가 빠르게 달릴 수 있는 도로.

examples.master: 명절에는 고속도로가 매우 막혀요.

en.explanation: A road where cars can travel fast.

examples.intermediate: It's faster to take the highway.
examples.advanced: You have to pay a highway toll.
examples.master: Highways are very congested during holidays.

examples.advanced: 경유 비행은 직항보다 시간이 더 걸려요.
examples.master: 경유지에서 입국 심사를 받아야 할 수도 있어요.

en.explanation: Going through a place on the way.

examples.intermediate: I'm going to America via Tokyo.
examples.advanced: Flights with stopovers take longer than direct flights.
examples.master: You may need to go through immigration at the stopover.

ko.explanation: 중간에 서지 않고 바로 가는 비행.

examples.master: 직항 노선이 없으면 가장 짧은 경유지를 찾아보세요.

en.explanation: A flight that goes straight without stopping.

examples.intermediate: There's a direct flight from Seoul to LA.
examples.advanced: Direct flights are more expensive than connecting flights.
examples.master: If there's no direct route, look for the shortest stopover.
항공사마다 취소비 정책이 달라요.

en.explanation: The cost of canceling a reservation.

examples.intermediate: How much is the cancellation fee?
examples.advanced: The cancellation fee is 50% if you cancel the day before.
examples.master: Cancellation fee policies differ by airline.
탑승권에 좌석 번호와 탑승구 정보가 있어요.

en.explanation: A pass that allows boarding an airplane.

examples.master: The boarding pass shows seat number and gate information.
체크인은 출발 3시간 전부터 가능해요.

en.explanation: Processing procedures before boarding a plane.

examples.master: Check-in opens 3 hours before departure.

ko.explanation: 공항에서 위험물 소지 여부를 확인하는 것.

examples.master: 보안 검사 줄이 길면 빠른 탑승 서비스를 이용하세요.

en.explanation: Checking for dangerous items at the airport.

examples.intermediate: You need to pass through security.
examples.master: Use fast-track service if the security line is long.
입국 목적을 물어볼 수 있으니 미리 준비하세요.

en.explanation: Entering another country.

examples.advanced: You need to fill out an arrival card.
examples.master: Prepare in advance as they may ask your purpose of entry.

ko.explanation: 자기 나라를 떠나 다른 나라로 가는 것.

examples.master: 출국 전에 여권 유효기간을 확인하세요.

en.explanation: Leaving your country to go to another.

examples.advanced: I said goodbye to my family at the departure hall.
examples.master: Check your passport validity before departure.

ko.explanation: 도로나 다리를 이용할 때 내는 비용.

examples.master: 통행료가 비싸서 국도로 갔어요.

en.explanation: A fee paid to use roads or bridges.

examples.advanced: Paying tolls with Hi-Pass is faster.
examples.master: I took the local road because the toll was expensive.
대중교통 무료 환승 제도가 잘 되어 있어요.

en.explanation: Transportation used by many people together.

examples.advanced: Using public transportation is good for the environment.
examples.master: The free transfer system for public transit works well.
내비게이션으로 교통 정체를 피할 수 있어요.

en.explanation: A state where vehicles can't move due to heavy traffic.

examples.advanced: There's traffic congestion during rush hour.
examples.master: You can avoid traffic jams using navigation.
장기 렌트가 단기보다 싸요.

en.explanation: Borrowing a car or item for payment.

examples.advanced: You need a rental car in Jeju.
examples.master: Long-term rental is cheaper than short-term.
실시간 교통 정보가 반영되는 내비가 좋아요.

en.explanation: A device that guides you to your destination.

examples.advanced: I found the way easily thanks to navigation.
examples.master: Navigation with real-time traffic info is better.
시내버스로 환승하면 할인돼요.

en.explanation: A bus that travels within a city.

examples.master: You get a discount when transferring to a city bus.
출퇴근 시간 광역버스는 자리가 없어요.

en.explanation: A bus connecting different cities.

examples.intermediate: Express buses are faster than city buses.
examples.master: There are no seats on express buses during rush hour.
심야 공항버스도 있어요.

en.explanation: A bus that goes to and from the airport.

examples.advanced: You can load luggage on the airport bus.
examples.master: There are late-night airport buses too.
KTX 자유석은 입석으로 서서 가야 할 수도 있어요.

en.explanation: Korea's high-speed train.

examples.intermediate: It takes 2.5 hours from Seoul to Busan by KTX.
examples.advanced: KTX tickets are cheaper if you book in advance.
examples.master: With KTX free seating, you might have to stand.
전철 노선이 계속 확대되고 있어요.

en.explanation: A train powered by electricity.

examples.intermediate: Metro and subway are the same.
examples.advanced: The metropolitan metro connects Seoul and Gyeonggi.
examples.master: Metro lines continue to expand.

examples.advanced: 하이패스가 있으면 톨게이트에서 멈추지 않아도 돼요.
examples.master: 하이패스 단말기를 렌트카에도 설치할 수 있어요.

en.explanation: An automatic toll payment system for highways.

examples.advanced: With Hi-Pass, you don't need to stop at the toll gate.
examples.master: You can install a Hi-Pass device in rental cars too.

examples.advanced: 앱으로 택시를 부르면 기사님 정보를 미리 볼 수 있어요.
examples.master: 심야에는 앱 호출이 더 안전해요.

en.explanation: An app to call taxis using a smartphone.

examples.beginner: I call a taxi by app.
examples.intermediate: I called a taxi through KakaoTaxi.
examples.advanced: When you call a taxi through the app, you can see driver info in advance.
examples.master: App calls are safer late at night.
